Description Text:
The U.S. Marshals Service (USMS), Justice Prisoner and Alien Transportation System (JPATS) intends to negotiate and award under the authority of FAR Part 13 to The Boeing Company, PO Box 3707, MC 21-22, Seattle, Washington 98124, for a subscription services to MyBoeingFleet.com for aircraft maintenance and operations manuals and publications along with revision services, for JPATS fleet of aircraft, two (2) Boeing 737-400’s, two (2) Boeing 737-700, and one (1) Boeing 737-800.  These aircraft are maintained and operated to mandatory regulatory requirements of Title 14 CFR Part 91 for flight into National airspace. As a minimum, access to the following manuals are required by JPATS in order to perform the JPATS operational missions: Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM), Fault Isolation Manual, Fault Report Manual, Illustrated Parts Catalog (IPC), Maintenance Planning Data, Structural Repair Manual (SRM), System Schematic Manual and the Wiring Diagram Manual, Flight Operations Manuals (FCOM), and Quick Reference Handbooks (QRH). In addition, to these publications, the requirement also includes revision services that will provide an approved system for periodic revisions of each of the manuals identified above ensuring that each remains current with the latest data from the aircraft manufacturer and airworthiness authorities. Lastly, this service must include the ability to access Service Bulletins and Service Letters from Boeing in addition to Airworthiness Directives from the FAA both digitally (website) and in some cases hard copy, as requested by JPATS. The period of performance will be from October 1, 2024 – September 30, 2025.

Description Text: The U.S. Marshals Service (USMS), Justice Prisoner and Alien Transportation System (JPATS) intends to negotiate and award under the authority of FAR Part 13 to The Boeing Company, PO Box 3707, MC 21-22, Seattle, Washington 98124, for a subscription services to MyBoeingFleet.com for aircraft maintenance and operations manuals and publications along with revision services, for three (3) JPATS owned Boeing 737-400 aircraft and one (1) Boeing 737-700 aircraft.  These aircraft are maintained and operated to mandatory regulatory requirements of Title 14 CFR Part 91 for flight into National airspace.  The aircraft are serial numbers 26073, 26078, 26279, and 30182 with registration numbers N639CS, N640CS, N279AD and N738A respectively.  As a minimum, access to the following manuals are required by JPATS in order to perform the JPATS operational missions:  Aircraft Maintenance Manual (AMM), Fault Isolation Manual, Fault Report Manual, Illustrated Parts Catalog (IPC), Maintenance Planning Data, Structural Repair Manual (SRM), System Schematic Manual and the Wiring Diagram Manual, Flight Operations Manuals (FCOM), and Quick Reference Handbooks (QRH).  In addition, to these publications, the requirement also includes revision services that will provide an approved system for periodic revisions of each of the manuals identified above ensuring that each remains current with the latest data from the aircraft manufacturer and airworthiness authorities.  Lastly, this service must include the ability to access Service Bulletins and Service Letters from Boeing in addition to Airworthiness Directives from the FAA both digitally (website) and in some cases hard copy, as requested by JPATS.  The period of performance will be from February 1, 2021 – January 31, 2022.  This notice is neither a request for competitive proposals nor a solicitation of offers.  Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether there is an opportunity to conduct a competitive procurement.  A determination by the Government not to compete this requirement will be based upon responses to this notice and is solely within the discretion of the Government.
